metadata.dc:author: Ramírez Huaranga, Marco Aurelio
Ariza Hernández, Andrés
Ramos Rodríguez, Claudia Carolina
González García, Jesús
metadata.dc:description: Meralgia paresthetica is a mononeuropathy of the femoral cutaneous nerve with characteristic findings, usually secondary to injury or compression, being most common in the inguinal area. Exceptional cases associated with compressions caused by abdominal or pelvic tumors have been published, so it is always advisable to extend the study with imaging tests. We present a case associated with a renal tumor.
metadata.dc:subject: Femoral cutaneous nerve
Meralgia parestésica
Nervio femorocutáneo
Meralgia paresthetica
Tumor renal
Renal tumor
metadata.dc:title: What meralgia paresthetica can hide: renal tumor as an infrequent cause.
